43namespace internal {

45// static
46v8::Platform* V8::platform_ = nullptr;
47const OOMDetails V8::kNoOOMDetails{false, nullptr};
48const OOMDetails V8::kHeapOOM{true, nullptr};
49
50namespace {
51enum class V8StartupState {
52 kIdle,
53 kPlatformInitializing,
54 kPlatformInitialized,
55 kV8Initializing,
56 kV8Initialized,
57 kV8Disposing,
58 kV8Disposed,
59 kPlatformDisposing,
60 kPlatformDisposed
61};
62
63std::atomic<V8StartupState> v8_startup_state_(V8StartupState::kIdle);
64
65void AdvanceStartupState(V8StartupState expected_next_state) {
66 V8StartupState current_state = v8_startup_state_;
67 CHECK_NE(current_state, V8StartupState::kPlatformDisposed);
68 V8StartupState next_state =
69 static_cast<V8StartupState>(static_cast<int>(current_state) + 1);
70 if (next_state != expected_next_state) {
71 // Ensure the following order:
72 // v8::V8::InitializePlatform(platform);
73 // v8::V8::Initialize();
74 // v8::Isolate* isolate = v8::Isolate::New(...);
75 // ...
76 // isolate->Dispose();
77 // v8::V8::Dispose();
78 // v8::V8::DisposePlatform();
79 FATAL("Wrong initialization order: from %d to %d, expected to %d!",
80 static_cast<int>(current_state), static_cast<int>(next_state),
81 static_cast<int>(expected_next_state));
82 }
83 if (!v8_startup_state_.compare_exchange_strong(current_state, next_state)) {
84 FATAL(
85 "Multiple threads are initializating V8 in the wrong order: expected "
86 "%d got %d!",
87 static_cast<int>(current_state),
88 static_cast<int>(v8_startup_state_.load()));
89 }
90}
91
92} // namespace
93
94#ifdef V8_USE_EXTERNAL_STARTUP_DATA
95V8_DECLARE_ONCE(init_snapshot_once);
96#endif
97
98// static
99void V8::InitializePlatform(v8::Platform* platform) {
100 AdvanceStartupState(V8StartupState::kPlatformInitializing);
101 CHECK(!platform_);
102 CHECK_NOT_NULL(platform);
103 platform_ = platform;
104 v8::base::SetPrintStackTrace(platform_->GetStackTracePrinter());
105 v8::tracing::TracingCategoryObserver::SetUp();
106#if defined(V8_OS_WIN) && defined(V8_ENABLE_ETW_STACK_WALKING)
107 if (v8_flags.enable_etw_stack_walking) {
108 // TODO(sartang@microsoft.com): Move to platform specific diagnostics object
109 v8::internal::ETWJITInterface::Register();
110 }
111#endif
112
113 // Initialization needs to happen on platform-level, as this sets up some
114 // cppgc internals that are needed to allow gracefully failing during cppgc
115 // platform setup.
116 CppHeap::InitializeOncePerProcess();
117
118 AdvanceStartupState(V8StartupState::kPlatformInitialized);
119}
120
121// static
122void V8::InitializePlatformForTesting(v8::Platform* platform) {
123 if (v8_startup_state_ != V8StartupState::kIdle) {
124 FATAL(
125 "The platform was initialized before. Note that running multiple tests "
126 "in the same process is not supported.");
127 }
128 V8::InitializePlatform(platform);
129}
130
131#define DISABLE_FLAG(flag) \
132 if (v8_flags.flag) { \
133 PrintF(stderr, \
134 "Warning: disabling flag --" #flag " due to conflicting flags\n"); \
135 v8_flags.flag = false; \
136 }
137
138void V8::Initialize() {
139 AdvanceStartupState(V8StartupState::kV8Initializing);
140 CHECK(platform_);
141
142 // Update logging information before enforcing flag implications.
143 FlagValue<bool>* log_all_flags[] = {
144 &v8_flags.log_all,
145 &v8_flags.log_code,
146 &v8_flags.log_code_disassemble,
147 &v8_flags.log_deopt,
148 &v8_flags.log_feedback_vector,
149 &v8_flags.log_function_events,
150 &v8_flags.log_ic,
151 &v8_flags.log_maps,
152 &v8_flags.log_source_code,
153 &v8_flags.log_source_position,
154 &v8_flags.log_timer_events,
155 &v8_flags.prof,
156 &v8_flags.prof_cpp,
157 };
158 if (v8_flags.log_all) {
159 // Enable all logging flags
160 for (auto* flag : log_all_flags) {
161 *flag = true;
162 }
163 v8_flags.log = true;
164 } else if (!v8_flags.log) {
165 // Enable --log if any log flag is set.
166 for (const auto* flag : log_all_flags) {
167 if (!*flag) continue;
168 v8_flags.log = true;
169 break;
170 }
171 // Profiling flags depend on logging.
172 v8_flags.log = v8_flags.log || v8_flags.perf_prof ||
173 v8_flags.perf_basic_prof || v8_flags.ll_prof ||
174 v8_flags.prof || v8_flags.prof_cpp || v8_flags.gdbjit;
175 }
176
177 FlagList::EnforceFlagImplications();
178
179 if (v8_flags.predictable && v8_flags.random_seed == 0) {
180 // Avoid random seeds in predictable mode.
181 v8_flags.random_seed = 12347;
182 }
183
184 if (v8_flags.stress_compaction) {
185 v8_flags.force_marking_deque_overflows = true;
186 v8_flags.gc_global = true;
187 v8_flags.max_semi_space_size = 1;
188 }
189
190 if (v8_flags.trace_turbo) {
191 // Create an empty file shared by the process (e.g. the wasm engine).
192 std::ofstream(Isolate::GetTurboCfgFileName(nullptr).c_str(),
193 std::ios_base::trunc);
194 }
195
196 // Do not expose wasm in jitless mode.
197 //
198 // Even in interpreter-only mode, wasm currently still creates executable
199 // memory at runtime. Unexpose wasm until this changes.
200 // The correctness fuzzers are a special case: many of their test cases are
201 // built by fetching a random property from the the global object, and thus
202 // the global object layout must not change between configs. That is why we
203 // continue exposing wasm on correctness fuzzers even in jitless mode.
204 // TODO(jgruber): Remove this once / if wasm can run without executable
205 // memory.
206#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
207 if (v8_flags.jitless && !v8_flags.correctness_fuzzer_suppressions) {
208 DISABLE_FLAG(expose_wasm);
209 }
210#endif
211
212 // When fuzzing and concurrent compilation is enabled, disable Turbofan
213 // tracing flags since reading/printing heap state is not thread-safe and
214 // leads to false positives on TSAN bots.
215 // TODO(chromium:1205289): Teach relevant fuzzers to not pass TF tracing
216 // flags instead, and remove this section.
217 if (v8_flags.fuzzing && v8_flags.concurrent_recompilation) {
218 DISABLE_FLAG(trace_turbo);
219 DISABLE_FLAG(trace_turbo_graph);
220 DISABLE_FLAG(trace_turbo_scheduled);
221 DISABLE_FLAG(trace_turbo_reduction);
222#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SLOW_TRACING
223 // If expensive tracing is disabled via a build flag, the following flags
224 // cannot be disabled (because they are already).
225 DISABLE_FLAG(trace_turbo_trimming);
226 DISABLE_FLAG(trace_turbo_jt);
227 DISABLE_FLAG(trace_turbo_ceq);
228 DISABLE_FLAG(trace_turbo_loop);
229 DISABLE_FLAG(trace_turbo_alloc);
230 DISABLE_FLAG(trace_all_uses);
231 DISABLE_FLAG(trace_representation);
232#endif
233 DISABLE_FLAG(trace_turbo_stack_accesses);
234 }
235
236 // The --jitless and --interpreted-frames-native-stack flags are incompatible
237 // since the latter requires code generation while the former prohibits code
238 // generation.
239 CHECK(!v8_flags.interpreted_frames_native_stack || !v8_flags.jitless);
240
241 base::AbortMode abort_mode = base::AbortMode::kDefault;
242
243 if (v8_flags.soft_abort) {
244 abort_mode = base::AbortMode::kSoft;
245 } else if (v8_flags.hard_abort) {
246 abort_mode = base::AbortMode::kHard;
247 }
248
249 base::OS::Initialize(abort_mode, v8_flags.gc_fake_mmap);
250
251 if (v8_flags.random_seed) {
252 GetPlatformPageAllocator()->SetRandomMmapSeed(v8_flags.random_seed);
253 GetPlatformVirtualAddressSpace()->SetRandomSeed(v8_flags.random_seed);
254 }
255
256 if (v8_flags.print_flag_values) FlagList::PrintValues();
257
258 // Initialize the default FlagList::Hash.
259 FlagList::Hash();
260
261 // Before initializing internals, freeze the flags such that further changes
262 // are not allowed. Global initialization of the Isolate or the WasmEngine
263 // already reads flags, so they should not be changed afterwards.
264 if (v8_flags.freeze_flags_after_init) FlagList::FreezeFlags();
265
266#if defined(V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX)
267 // If enabled, the sandbox must be initialized first.
268 GetProcessWideSandbox()->Initialize(GetPlatformVirtualAddressSpace());
269 CHECK_EQ(kSandboxSize, GetProcessWideSandbox()->size());
270
271 GetProcessWideCodePointerTable()->Initialize();
272#endif
273
274#if defined(V8_USE_PERFETTO)
275 if (perfetto::Tracing::IsInitialized()) {
276 TrackEvent::Register();
277 if (v8_flags.perfetto_code_logger) {
278 v8::internal::CodeDataSource::Register();
279 }
280 }
281#endif
282 IsolateGroup::InitializeOncePerProcess();
283 Isolate::InitializeOncePerProcess();
284
285#if defined(USE_SIMULATOR)
286 Simulator::InitializeOncePerProcess();
287#endif
288 CpuFeatures::Probe(false);
289 ElementsAccessor::InitializeOncePerProcess();
290 Bootstrapper::InitializeOncePerProcess();
291 CallDescriptors::InitializeOncePerProcess();
292
293 // Fetch the ThreadIsolatedAllocator once since we need to keep the pointer in
294 // protected memory.
295 ThreadIsolation::Initialize(
296 GetCurrentPlatform()->GetThreadIsolatedAllocator());
297
298#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
299 wasm::WasmEngine::InitializeOncePerProcess();
300#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
301
302 ExternalReferenceTable::InitializeOncePerProcess();
303
304 AdvanceStartupState(V8StartupState::kV8Initialized);
305}
306
307#undef DISABLE_FLAG
308
309void V8::Dispose() {
310 AdvanceStartupState(V8StartupState::kV8Disposing);
311 CHECK(platform_);
312#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
313 wasm::WasmEngine::GlobalTearDown();
314#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
315#if defined(USE_SIMULATOR)
316 Simulator::GlobalTearDown();
317#endif
318 CallDescriptors::TearDown();
319 ElementsAccessor::TearDown();
320 RegisteredExtension::UnregisterAll();
321 FlagList::ReleaseDynamicAllocations();
322 AdvanceStartupState(V8StartupState::kV8Disposed);
323}
324
325void V8::DisposePlatform() {
326 AdvanceStartupState(V8StartupState::kPlatformDisposing);
327 CHECK(platform_);
328#if defined(V8_OS_WIN) && defined(V8_ENABLE_ETW_STACK_WALKING)
329 if (v8_flags.enable_etw_stack_walking) {
330 v8::internal::ETWJITInterface::Unregister();
331 }
332#endif
333 v8::tracing::TracingCategoryObserver::TearDown();
334 v8::base::SetPrintStackTrace(nullptr);
335
336#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
337 // TODO(chromium:1218005) alternatively, this could move to its own
338 // public TearDownSandbox function.
339 GetProcessWideSandbox()->TearDown();
340#endif // V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
341
342 platform_ = nullptr;
343
344#if DEBUG
345 internal::ThreadIsolation::CheckTrackedMemoryEmpty();
346#endif
347
348 AdvanceStartupState(V8StartupState::kPlatformDisposed);
349}
350
351v8::Platform* V8::GetCurrentPlatform() {
352 v8::Platform* platform = reinterpret_cast<v8::Platform*>(
353 base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<base::AtomicWord*>(&platform_)));
354 DCHECK(platform);
355 return platform;
356}
357
358void V8::SetPlatformForTesting(v8::Platform* platform) {
359 base::Relaxed_Store(reinterpret_cast<base::AtomicWord*>(&platform_),
360 reinterpret_cast<base::AtomicWord>(platform));
361}
362
363void V8::SetSnapshotBlob(StartupData* snapshot_blob) {
364#ifdef V8_USE_EXTERNAL_STARTUP_DATA
365 base::CallOnce(&init_snapshot_once, &SetSnapshotFromFile, snapshot_blob);
366#else
367 UNREACHABLE();
368#endif
369}
370} // namespace internal
371
372// static
373double Platform::SystemClockTimeMillis() {
374 return base::OS::TimeCurrentMillis();
375}
376
377// static
378void ThreadIsolatedAllocator::SetDefaultPermissionsForSignalHandler() {
379#if V8_HAS_PKU_JIT_WRITE_PROTECT
380 internal::RwxMemoryWriteScope::SetDefaultPermissionsForSignalHandler();
381#endif
382}
